clinical_study.brief_title: Transdiagnostic REBT Prevention Program for Children
clinical_study.official_title: The Efficacy of a Technology-enhanced Group Transdiagnostic REBT Prevention Program for Internalizing Symptoms Delivered in a School Setting

brief_summary.textblock:
Anxiety and depressive disorders are common in children and adolescents, however they are often unrecognized. Rational emotive behavioral therapy (REBT), a form of cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) is efficient for children and adolescents. School settings are appropriate environments to deliver such interventions for vulnerable youths. Given youth's access and predilection to use technology, a technology-enhanced prevention program was developed. The present study aims to investigate the efficacy of a transdiagnosticREBT prevention program for internalizing symptoms in children and adolescents, implemented in a school setting.
Classes from different Romanian public schools will be randomized in either intervention or wait list group. The prevention program will be group-based, delivered in 6 sessions, over 3 weeks. Participants would be assessed baseline and post-intervention. Each of the six modules aimed a different component: Psychoeducation, Relaxation and Breathing, Relationship between cognitive distortions/irrational beliefs and emotions, Cognitive restructuring, Exposure, Maintenance of gaining. Despite specific activities, for each session a cartoon on that subject will be viewed and discussed. Homework would be given at every session.
REBT/CBT prevention programs delivered in school settings represent ecological modalities to target vulnerable groups. Technology components added to traditional programs may lead to greater motivation and satisfaction with treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: The Multidimensional Anxiety Scale for Children (MASC)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline anxiety symptoms at 3 weeks post-intervention, 1 month follow up, 12 months follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life scale for children and adolescents (QoL)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline quality of life at 3 weeks post-intervention, 1 month follow up, 12 months follow-up
Change from baseline automatic thoughts at 3 weeks post-intervention, 1 month follow up, 12 months follow-up
Change from baseline depressive symptoms at 3 weeks post-intervention, 1 month follow up, 12 months follow-up

arm_group.description: Children and adolescents in the experimental group attend 6 modules of group-based technology enhanced rational emotive behavioral therapy (REBT). Each of the six modules aimed a different component: Psychoeducation, Relaxation and Breathing, Relationship between cognitive distortions/irrational beliefs and emotions, Cognitive restructuring, Exposure, Maintenance of gaining.
The wait-list is a delayed treatment condition.

intervention.intervention_name: technology enhanced rational emotive behavioral therapy
intervention.description: The rational emotive behavioral therapy prevention program technology enhanced consists of 6 sessions delivered in a group format.
